name: Bidirectional ClickUp Task & Google Calendar Sync with Multi-Calendar Routing

user.name: R4wd0G
user.bio: Feel free to send me an email if you have any questions: n8n.eldest410@aleeas.com

description:
## Who‚Äôs it for
Teams that manage tasks in ClickUp and want those tasks reflected‚Äîand kept in sync‚Äîin Google Calendar automatically.

## How it works
A ClickUp Trigger captures task events (create, update, delete). For new tasks, the workflow creates a Google Calendar event with the correct start/end. It stores a mapping between `clickupTaskId` and `calendarEventId` in a Google Sheet so later updates and deletions can target the right event. Multiple lanes (personal/school/tech/internship) let you route tasks to different calendars.

## How to set up
1. Assign **ClickUp OAuth**, **Google Calendar**, and **Google Sheets** credentials to the nodes.
2. Open the **Configuration** node and fill:
   - `calendarId_*` for each lane
   - `sheetId` and `sheetTabName` for the mapping sheet
   - (optional) `clickupTeamId`
3. Enable the **ClickUp Trigger** and run a manual test to validate mapping creation and event syncing.

## Requirements
- ClickUp workspace with OAuth permissions
- Google Calendar & Sheets access
- A Google Sheet for the event‚Üîtask mapping

## How to customize the workflow
- Edit the calendar routing in **Edit Fields** nodes or point them to different `calendarId_*` values.
- Adjust event colors/fields in Google Calendar nodes.
- Extend the mapping sheet with extra columns (e.g., status, labels) as needed.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

parameters.content:
## Template Instructions
Sync **ClickUp tasks ‚Üí Google Calendar** (create, update, delete) and keep a mapping in Google Sheets.

**Setup**
1) Open **Configuration** and set `calendarId_*`, `sheetId`, `sheetTabName`, and `clickupTeamId`.
2) Assign your **Google** and **ClickUp** credentials to the nodes after import.
3) Enable the trigger and test.

**Notes**
- Mapping sheet stores `clickupTaskId`, `calendarEventId`, `eventName`.
- No secrets in JSON; credentials are selected at runtime.

## Create ‚Äì ClickUp ‚Üí Google Calendar
**When it runs**: on `taskCreated` (and tasks routed to a lane via `Switch2`).

**What happens**
1) `Edit Fields*` injects the target `calendarId` from **Configuration**.
2) `Google Calendar9 (getAll)` searches recent events (updated in the last ~5 min) with the **same summary** to avoid duplicates.
3) If no matching event is found, `Google Calendar10 (create)` creates the event using:
   - **summary** ‚Üí ClickUp task name
   - **description** ‚Üí ClickUp task description
   - **start/end** ‚Üí from ClickUp `start_date` / `due_date` (milliseconds ‚Üí formatted)
   - **color** ‚Üí fixed in the node (adjust if needed)
4) `Google Sheets (append)` stores a mapping row: `clickupTaskId`, `calendarEventId`, `eventName`.

**Notes & tips**
- If you want stricter de‚Äëduplication, expand the search window or also compare description.
- To change routing, edit `Switch2` conditions or point `Edit Fields*` to other `calendarId_*` variables.
- Make sure the **mapping sheet** exists and the tab name matches `sheetTabName` in **Configuration**.

## Update ‚Äì Keep Calendar in sync with ClickUp changes
**When it runs**: on `taskUpdated` and `taskDueDateUpdated`.

**How it works**
1) The flow fetches the existing event using the stored mapping (rows filtered by `clickupTaskId`).
2) Branches handle **timed vs all‚Äëday** events via `if_allDayEvent*` conditions.
3) The corresponding `Google Calendar* (update)` node updates fields:
   - `summary` ‚Üê ClickUp task name
   - `description` ‚Üê ClickUp task description
   - `start/end` ‚Üê ClickUp `start_date` / `due_date` (for all‚Äëday, `allday: yes` with date only)
   - `color` ‚Üê set per lane; adjust if you want to reflect ClickUp priority/status
4) Several `If*` nodes compare values (title, description, start/end) to reduce **unnecessary writes**.

**Edge cases**
- If a mapping row is missing, you can **fallback to create** or log the anomaly.
- Verify timezone handling in your credentials; convert to UTC if your ClickUp dates are inconsistent.
- For recurring events, consider handling series IDs separately (this template targets single events).

## Delete ‚Äì Remove event and clean mapping
**When it runs**: on `taskDeleted` (or status flow that implies deletion).

**What happens**
1) `Google Sheets2 (lookup)` finds the mapping row by `clickupTaskId`.
2) `Google Calendar11..14 (delete)` attempts deletion on the target calendar (per lane). Nodes are set to **continue on error** so a missing event doesn‚Äôt break the run.
3) `Google Sheets1 (delete)` removes the mapping row to keep the sheet tidy.

**Notes & options**
- Prefer **soft delete**? Replace deletion with a color change or `Cancelled` suffix.
- Add a Slack/Telegram notification after successful deletion if you need auditability.
- If your tasks can move lanes, ensure you update the stored `calendarId` or re‚Äëdetect it before deleting.
